snippet: A three-judge panel ruled that Albert Woodfox, who has served nearly 40 years for the murder of a prison guard, should stay in prison as the state appeals a federal order to free him.
abstract: Federal appeals court panel in Louisiana denies immediate release of Albert Woodfox, inmate who has spent nearly four decades in solitary confinement for 1972 murder of prison guard, despite his conviction being overturned twice; rules Woodfox must stay imprisoned as state appeals federal order to free him.
lead_paragraph: A three-judge panel ruled that Albert Woodfox, who has served nearly 40 years for the murder of a prison guard, should stay in prison as the state appeals a federal order to free him.

headline.main: Louisiana Court Blocks Release of ‘Angola Three’ Inmate
headline.print_headline: Louisiana Court Blocks Release of ‘Angola Three’ Inmate in Prison for Decades
